questions.question: Can static member functions be virtual?
options: No, static member functions can never be virtual

questions.question: What is an Interface?
options: Contains only declarations of methods, properties (no implementation)

questions.question: How many interfaces can a class implement?
What is an Abstract Class?
options: A class that can be instantiated
A class that is declared abstract, may or may not include abstract methods

questions.question: How many abstract classes can a class extend?
Can an abstract class be instantiated?
options: No, abstract class cannot be instantiated

questions.question: What is a Concrete Class?
options: A class that has implementation for all of its methods

questions.question: What is Abstraction?
options: Hiding data with getters and setters
Works on design level - hides unnecessary data, highlights what object does

questions.question: What is Encapsulation?
options: Works on application level - binds data and functionalities, hides code and data together

questions.question: What is UpCasting?
options: Using sub class reference for super class object
Using super class's reference to refer to sub class's object

questions.question: What is the main purpose of an Abstract Class?
options: To define common behavior that can be inherited by multiple subclasses

questions.question: What access modifier must implementing members use when a class implements an interface?
Can an interface include private members?
options: No, interface cannot include private, protected, or internal members

questions.question: What are methods declared in interface by default?
What are variables declared in interface by default?
Can abstract classes have constructors?
options: Yes, abstract classes can have constructors

questions.question: What is the difference between Abstraction and Encapsulation?
options: Abstraction focuses on design level, Encapsulation on application level
Encapsulation focuses on design, Abstraction on application

questions.question: What is an Abstract Method?
options: Method declared without implementation in abstract class

questions.question: What must a class do when implementing an interface?
What is the main advantage of interfaces?
What happens if a subclass doesn't implement all abstract methods?
options: It must also be declared abstract

questions.question: What is the main use of abstract classes?
What does Encapsulation support?
What does Abstraction support?
What is the relationship between Abstraction, Interface, and Encapsulation?
options: Abstraction extracts required attributes, Encapsulation makes a class from those things
